text:
Hello! I pulled a remote branch from github and run `hs watch` . It's uploading a bunch of files without any issues but I see 3 files failing for the same reason as below:

```[ERROR] Uploading file "[...]/templates/retail.html" to "my-website-theme/templates/retail.html" failed
[ERROR] Error validating template.
[ERROR] line 0: Template does not include the tag {{ standard_footer_includes }}. Needed for HubSpot analytics```
These 3 templates do not have {{ standard_footer_includes }} but the base.html file that they extend does.

Any ideas anyone?
Thanks!

Here’s a diagram from some docs I wrote for the company I work for on the dev setup.

The blurred out blue is the links to the websites.

The only trick is without being able to store each page’s content itself it can get a little dicey making updates, haha. Even w/ the dev environment.

IE if renaming module identifiers can lose info, etc (as far as I’m aware that seems to be the case). I think it’s recoverable if the name is reversed back but not sure.

Also have to kind of manually sync the dev/live site.

Unless you want to forgo content creators editing the website and do all the overrides in the template but that seems nightmarish.

This is my understanding, someone correct me if any of that is incorrect.
